quest.name: Siren Flower
journal:
 Quest Sync
A familiar aficionado at Poieten Oikos is most interested in meeting you.
objectives: Speak with the familiar aficionado again.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: A rather unusual familiar, aren't you?

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: I haven't seen your concept on file at the Bureau of the Architect, and I've never come across anything like you in all my years of research.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: You're Azem's familiar? Well, that certainly explains it! HerHis creations are truly something else.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: I'm even more intrigued now. Would you mind if I observed you for a time? I'll make it worth your while, of course.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Fantastic! I can hardly wait to get started...but not here.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: The study I'd like to conduct requires we relocate to the west a ways. Please come and join me when you're ready!

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for coming. Now, let's get straight to business.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: All you need to do is reach out and touch some Orpheus songflowers. They're pretty blooms, light blue in color, and they emit these, well, “bubbles” which enthrall any overly curious creatures. Think of it as a defensive mechanism.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: It has no effect on sapient beings such as myself, but I'm fascinated to know how it will affect you.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Fear not─I will be sure to intervene should you begin to fall under its spell! I would never leave a familiar to such a fate, and especially not a familiar created by Azem!

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Now, I've created three flowers of varying sizes and potencies. We'll begin with the smallest and weakest.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Oh, I may be able to protect you from the flower itself, but if any nearby beasts are already under its influence, I'm afraid you'll have to be the one to protect me. Fighting was never my forte...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Escort the familiar aficionado to the flower. Should you fail to defend him, or move too far away, he will return to the starting position, where you may rendezvous with him before trying again.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Let's be off!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Urgh...

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: There you are! Shall we be off to the flower, then?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have failed to successfully escort the familiar aficionado to the flower. Return to the starting point and speak with him to begin once more.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have lost sight of the familiar aficionado. Retrace your steps to find them, then escort them safely to the flower.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You touch the flower. It doesn't seem to affect you.

dialogue.name: FLOWERA04302
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Aficionado-)Hm. No reaction. Interesting. Let's try a more powerful one, shall we?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You touch the flower. You don't feel any different.

dialogue.name: FLOWERB04302
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Aficionado-)Still nothing? Well, let's see how you fare against an exceptionally large one.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You touch the flower. Nothing happens.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Incredible. Even a flower this size has no effect on you whatsoever. I thought for sure you would be enthralled.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Considering the sparse nature of your aether, it simply doesn't make sense. Azem must possess some mastery which eludes me.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: In any case, that ends our experiment. I'll dissolve these blooms and meet you back at Poieten Oikos.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Thank you for lending me your time. It was most enlightening.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: Not to mention perplexing. You have so little aether, yet something keeps you resistant to outside influence. Your physical constitution, perhaps? It's something to consider when creating familiars in the future, at least.

dialogue.name: LOVER04302
dialogue.text: I promised you a reward, didn't I? Here you go. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some data analysis and concept planning to do.
